title: Portfolio Website
summary: This portfolio website you are currently on showcases my skills and projects in web development. I built it with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and it features an interactive blog and projects section powered by a JSON file, where I used Javascript to dynamically load and display the content, enabling smooth functionality for sorting and filtering, where the projects and blogs are stored in json files. It is a static website which I applied the skills learnt from COMP1531 on (mainly the JavaScript since it was a backend course).

title: MIPS Assembly Matrix Transposer
summary: Implemented a MIPS Assembly program to efficiently transpose a matrix by manipulating memory directly. This project deepened my understanding of low-level programming and memory management.

title: Lasagna Timer in Java
summary: Developed a Java program to calculate cooking times for lasagna using reusable methods within a class. This project strengthened my object-oriented programming skills and taught me how to structure reusable methods.

title: Bayes' Theorem Probability Calculator
summary: Created a tool using Maple to calculate probabilities based on Bayes' Theorem. This project reinforced my understanding of conditional probability and practical applications in real-world problems.

title: MATH2621 Course Summary Sheet
summary: Compiled a comprehensive summary sheet for MATH2621 using LaTeX. The document covers key concepts like analytic functions, series expansions, and major theorems of complex analysis.

title: Multithreaded File Monitor in C
summary: Developed a multithreaded C program to monitor file sizes and issue warnings when a quota is exceeded. This project improved my understanding of threads, synchronization, and working with the file system.

title: Leap Year Finder in JavaScript
summary: Created a JavaScript program to check leap years, count leap years in an array, and find the next leap year after a given year. This project honed my skills in working with arrays and conditional logic.

title: Graph Cycle Detection in C
summary: Implemented a function in C to detect cycles in a graph using a custom stack ADT. This project enhanced my knowledge of graph traversal algorithms like depth-first search.

title: Taylor Series Convergence Visualizer
summary: Built a visualization tool in Maple to analyze the radius and interval of convergence for Taylor series. The tool highlights convergence at endpoints with detailed plots.

title: COMP1511 Coding Assignments
summary: Completed a series of assignments for COMP1511, which included implementing algorithms, working with pointers, and creating data structures like linked lists. The assignments built a strong foundation in C programming.
